devdoc.custom:security: The timelock provides several security features: - Minimum delay of 30 minutes prevents immediate execution - Maximum delay of 30 days prevents indefinite delays - Grace period of 14 days for execution after delay expires - Only owner can queue and execute transactions - Transactions can be cancelled before execution
devdoc.custom:usage: Example usage: ```solidity // Queue a transaction to update vault providers timelock.queue(     vaultAddress,     0,     "setProviders(address[])",     encodedData,     block.timestamp + delay );  // After delay period, execute the transaction timelock.execute(     vaultAddress,     0,     "setProviders(address[])",     encodedData,     executionTimestamp ); ```
devdoc.details: This contract implements a governance mechanism that requires a time delay      before executing critical operations, providing security against malicious      or accidental changes to the protocol.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

Cancelled(bytes32,address,uint256,string.details: Emitted when a queued transaction is cancelled.

DelayUpdated(uint256).details: Emitted when the delay for queued transactions is updated.

Executed(bytes32,address,uint256,string,.details: Emitted when a queued transaction is executed.

Queued(bytes32,address,uint256,string,by.details: Emitted when a transaction is queued.

acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

params.data: The calldata for the function called on the target address.
params.signature: The function signature of the target contract.
params.target: The address of the contract to cancel the transaction for.
params.timestamp: The time when the transaction was scheduled to be executed.
params.value: The amount of ether that was to be sent with the call.

constructor.details: Initializes the Timelock contract with the specified parameters.

params.delay_: The initial delay for queued transactions.
params.owner_: The address of the initial owner of the contract.

execute(address,uint256,string,bytes,uin.custom:example: ```solidity // Execute a previously queued transaction bytes memory result = timelock.execute(     vaultAddress,     0,     "setProviders(address[])",     data,     originalTimestamp ); ```
execute(address,uint256,string,bytes,uin.details: The transaction must have been previously queuedThe current timestamp must be >= the execution timestampThe transaction must not have expired (timestamp + GRACE_PERIOD)Only the contract owner can execute transactionsThe transaction is removed from the queue after execution

params.data: The ABI-encoded parameters for the function call
params.signature: The function signature of the target contract
params.target: The address of the contract to call
params.timestamp: The original timestamp when the transaction was queued
params.value: The amount of ether to send with the call

returns._0: returnData The return data from the executed function call

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

queue(address,uint256,string,bytes,uint2.custom:example: ```solidity // Queue a transaction to update vault providers bytes memory data = abi.encode(newProviders); bytes32 txId = timelock.queue(     vaultAddress,     0,     "setProviders(address[])",     data,     block.timestamp + 24 hours ); ```
queue(address,uint256,string,bytes,uint2.details: The transaction ID is computed as keccak256(abi.encode(target, value, signature, data, timestamp))The timestamp must be at least `delay` seconds in the futureOnly the contract owner can queue transactions

params.data: The ABI-encoded parameters for the function call (without function selector)
params.signature: The function signature of the target contract (e.g., "setProviders(address[])")
params.target: The address of the contract to call
params.timestamp: The timestamp when the transaction can be executed (must be >= block.timestamp + delay)
params.value: The amount of ether to send with the call (0 for most calls)

returns._0: txId The unique transaction ID for this queued transaction

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._delay: The new delay duration in seconds.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner. Setting `newOwner` to the zero address is allowed; this can be used to cancel an initiated ownership transfer.

GRACE_PERIOD.details: After this period, transactions expire and cannot be executed

MAX_DELAY.details: Prevents indefinite delays that could lock the protocol

MIN_DELAY.details: Prevents immediate execution of critical operations

delay.details: Can be updated by the contract itself through setDelay()

queued.details: Transaction ID is computed as keccak256(abi.encode(target, value, signature, data, timestamp))

devdoc.title: Timelock

GRACE_PERIOD().notice: Grace period for executing queued transactions (14 days)

MAX_DELAY().notice: Maximum delay for queued transactions (30 days)

MIN_DELAY().notice: Minimum delay for queued transactions (30 minutes)

queue(address,uint256,string,bytes,uint2.notice: Queues a transaction for delayed execution

queued(bytes32).notice: Mapping of transaction IDs to their queued status

setDelay(uint256).notice: Sets a new delay for queued transactions.

userdoc.notice: A time-delayed execution contract for critical operations
